Irisbond Duo API

Build info

  • The API is compiled with VS2017 x86.
  • It’s written in C++ but the exported functions are in C to keep compatibility with other languages.

Functionalities

  • Detect when a Duo eye tracker is connected and retrieve its serial number
  • Start the eye tracker and the tracking process
  • Stop the eye tracker and the tracking process
  • Restart the eye tracker if an internal error occurs
  • Switch between monocular and binocular eyetracking
  • Show a positioning screen
  • Calibrate with 2, 3, 5, 9 or 16 points
  • Rectificate the calibration with a 1 point calibration
  • Improve a previous calibration with 3 points
  • Cancel a calibration
  • Configure calibration targets travel and fixation time
  • Configure a step-by-step calibration
  • Switch between default and custom calibration GUIs
  • Save the calibration between session
  • Get an event with the gaze data
  • Get an event when blink and dwell actions occur
  • Get an event with the live view from the camera
  • Get an event with the calibration target events for a custom calibration GUI
  • Get an event with the calibrations results
  • Switch between high and low performance modes

Tutorials

  • Integrating Irisbond Duo API in your project
  • Starting the API
  • Getting gaze points and tracking data
  • Getting blink and dwell events
  • Configuring the mouse speed and eye control
  • Getting the image from the camera
  • User Positioning
  • Simple Calibration (using the API default GUIs)
  • Advanced Calibration (using custom GUIs)
  • Step by step calibration
  • Testing
  • Getting and loading calibration data
  • High performance mode
  • High DPI screens

Backwards compatibility

In previous versions, the API dependencies were installed by “Duo API Libraries Setup x.x.x.exe” in ProgramFiles(x86)/Irisbond/... Since version 3.6.5 that changed and the only dependency must be located together with the API. The current driver installer only provides the camera drivers and VC++ packages. To keep compatibility with older APIs, the older dependencies installer will be available.
